data.title: Scope variables used in js_push_variant switch statement
data.body:
The variables used in js_push_variant should be scoped to the case they are used in (using braces for  the case)

https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/blob/master/Source/AtomicJS/Javascript/JSAPI.cpp#L408

data.title: Variant to Uint8Array mapping
.asset file line endings differ across platforms
data.body:
Opening one of the example projects on Windows, and then checking for differences in git, the line endings of .asset files  (which I assume were created on OSX) have changed. We've also seen this happen between different windows machines on our own assets, oddly enough. 

Serializing assets should use a single line ending format across platforms.

data.title: Remember player positioning when run from editor and Prevent multiple Atomic Player windows
WebSocket cleanup
data.body:
Don't get too excited. This doesn't have the Emscripten part, yet.

I have to apologize:

I realized that the WebSocket that I've been using and testing for a while now is not actually compatible with what I sent to you the first time. I cleaned up the code, and made this pull request to fix those incompatibilities.

Basically, this version does a lot less copying of messages. I'd like to get it to no copies, but it still might copy here or there. One main difference is that it doesn't copy a message into JavaScript space until it's requested. (An ID int could be at the beginning of a message, and the JS code could choose not to read it, which prevents an unnecessary copy. This is done be making the message a Deserializer instead of a String or PODVector (Yes, JavaScript PODVector<unsigned char> support is on it's way from me as well, but not in this pull.). Specifically, it uses a BufferQueue instance, even though messages would probably only ever be 1 buffer. I made the BufferQueue class for a better HTTP interface, not really for WebSockets, but because I had to bind it in JSIO, I wanted to keep the number of mixins necessary down for simplicity.

I promise to never make another incompatible change unless it's really necessary. Just to be clear, the only breaking change is with the WebSocket "message" event handler. Instead of "data" with a String object, you get "message", which is a Deserializer, and from that you can read a String or a Uint8Array, if you want the binary version. It's not present in JS memory until it's read from the Deserializer.

A corresponding AtomicExamples change is on it's way as well. It's only a 1 line change from:

```
console.log("WebSocket Message: " + event.data);
```

to:

```
console.log("WebSocket Message: " + event.message.readString());
```

Again, I'm sorry for not sending this change sooner, since it does require existing code to make a similar change in their "message" event handlers, but I know how the Atomic Game Engine works much better now, and I feel pretty strongly that this is a good change.

data.title: FileSystem.ScanDir only filters by extension
data.body: On Windows, FileSystem.ScanDir does not supoort arbitrary file filters, it only looks for files with a matching extension to the provided filter. Ideally it should support more complex filters, perhaps with regex support.

data.title: Fix build directory reference in GenerateVS2015.bat
data.body:
I manage a few copies of the engine based on what I'm adding. These copies are in the same root directory, but they are all named differently: "AtomicGameEngineWS", "AtomicGameEngineWR", "AtomicGameEngineWebM", etc.

When I was using CMake directly, that was not an issue. However, now I'm using jake to invoke CMake, and that script has a hard coded "AtomicGameEngine" directory in it for the source directory, even though it had already created a binary directory based on the source directory's name.

This patch passes that directory name through to the .bat file where it was previously hardcoded, so that my directory naming scheme works again.

data.title: In VS 2015 Access Violation on Present (D3D9)
data.body:
In D3D9Graphics.cpp on line 827:

```
        impl_->device_->Present(0, 0, 0, 0);
```

This line throws an access violation exception. If "break on access violation exceptions" are turned off in VS settings, then everything seems to work correctly.

data.title: Support for static class functions in JSBind. A version of ToString that takes an explicit vs_args parameter.
JSONFile resource type
If a resource ref atttribute fails to load, then the serializable with the attr is saved, it will lose the resource ref attr setting
data.body: This is very easy to trigger with JSONFile resource refs, as malformed JSON will cause a resource failure

data.title: Add JSON importer type
data.body: which can be applied in the inspector via a resourceref, should also be able to edit in js editor

data.title: Add indicator to actions requiring users to hit Save
data.body:
There should be a visual indicator that prefabs and materials have unsaved changes.

i.e. gray out/deactivate the save button if there are no changes

data.title: Project Panel list should show active object/material
data.body: When editing the import settings on models or materials, it is unclear which is being modified both in this list and in the Inspector panel.

data.title: Add deselect functionality to the scene view
data.body:
- Click on empty space in the scene to deselect all
- Hotkey - escape

data.title: Prevent .fbx files from being added to Resources when receiving the Asset Import Error
data.body:
The file(s) should not get added to the Resource list when this error pops up:

![fbx_error](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/722928/11101354/52a8ab06-886b-11e5-803e-2ab74cb1e17b.png)

data.title: Update buttons on Unsaved Modification window
data.body:
1. Move the current 'Ok' button to the left hand side of the window and rename it 'Don't Save'.
2. Add a Save button - this should save and close the current file.

![unsavedchanges](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/722928/11098646/3dc67a84-885b-11e5-95ca-3cf07294dc69.png)

data.title: Can't add a class without a default public constructor to JSBind
data.body:
In some cases classes might have constructors that are not intended to be called from atomic scripts (eg using a static factory method on the class to construct the instance). 

To deal with this case, if JSBind can't find a public constructor with arguments it can handle, it should not output a constructor mapping. Currently it still tries to, which causes uncompilable code to be generated.

data.title: Add HotKey cheatsheet to help menu
Adding Snap Settings
Resized scale icon
Don't report missing ToolPrefs as this isn't an error, raise an error
data.body: dialog if --player command line is invoked without loading project into editor first at least once

data.title: Support (and shortcuts) for Top, Bottom, Front, Back, Left, Right ortho views
Selection framing, orbit, zoom, additional camera translation and hotkeys
data.body:
Q/E: Translate camera up/down
F: Frame Selection
Alt + Left Mouse  - Orbit (once selection framed)
Alt + Middle Mouse - Move camera towards point ("Zoom")
X : Toggle World/Local gizmo axis mode

data.title: Prefabs need their own resource type so can be specified in inspector fields
Make ResourceRefList attributes editable in the inspector
Ability to play standalone scenes
data.body:
Art request:
It would be helpful to be able to play a scene in the editor without playing the main script, to see things like animations in just that scene.

data.title: Running with --player --project, first open of project fails looking for ToolPrefs.json
data.body:
To repro:
-Create a new atomic project
-Commit that project to source control without it's Cache directory
-Clone a fresh copy of the project
-Open this project using a VS2015 atomic solution and --player --project path/to/project commandline arguments
-Note an error popup about failing to find ToolPrefs.json

Workaround:
-Open the project once as normal in AtomicEditor
-Project can then be run using --player --project

data.title: Check if launched by editor
data.body: Closes #424
